column4: anyone know how I can fix my SDHC so i can partition it??   >> related http://pastebin.com/FgBg2XeG
no one knows how to fix ubuntu's issue reading dirty sdhc cards?
or can someone tell me how to pass my sdhc card to virtualbox so i can try formatting it in windows?
in line 9, you hosed the filesystem on /dev/mmcblk0p1. run mkfs.ext4.
(I'm hoping you didn't have data on there you're fond of)
/dev/mmcblk1: Read-only file system while setting up superblock
i was trying to fdisk it and it said i can't write to the disk
which is why i fsck while it was open
Obvious question: is the write-protect tab on the SD card set?
so it would mark it clean and ubuntu would quit marking it as dirty
figure for yourself whether or not the write protect is on or not
if write protect was On i wouldn't be able to copy that file to the sdhc in the last few steps
again  /dev/mmcblk1: Read-only file system while setting up superblock
